page.description: Runs a Javascript Action for the Grid Component that was defined using the Action Script builder.

argument.name: ele
argument.description: A pointer to a DOM element. This is only required if the action performs a task that is relative to other controls in the component, such as opening a window in a dropdown or positioned relative to another object.

discussion.p: Runs an action that was defined using the Action javascript builder. You can optionally pass in a pointer to the object that invokes the action.
Passing in a pointer to the element that invokes the action is necessary when the action you are running opens a 'dropdown' window or a window positioned relative to an object.

section.title: Running an Action
section.description: To run an action, simply call *[js:{grid.object}.runAction]* with the name of the action to execute.

section.title: Passing in a Pointer to an Element
section.description: Some actions, such as opening a window in a dropdown or a window that is positioned relative to another control, require additional information provided by passing an element to the *[js:{grid.object}.runAction]* method.
